intro: Alona tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly water flea, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly covering of fine hairs on its stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. This plant typically grows in shallow, still or slow-moving freshwater habitats such as ponds and lakes. Alona tomentosa is an important component of aquatic ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates. Its presence is often an indicator of good water quality and ecological balance.
